references.paper_title: Ubnormal: New benchmark for supervised open-set video anomaly detection
references.reason: This paper introduces a new benchmark dataset for open-set video anomaly detection, which is crucial for evaluating the generalizability of video anomaly detection models.

references.paper_title: A new comprehensive benchmark for semi-supervised video anomaly detection and anticipation
references.reason: This paper introduces a new benchmark dataset for semi-supervised video anomaly detection, providing a more comprehensive evaluation than previous benchmarks.

references.paper_title: Quo vadis, action recognition? a new model and the kinetics dataset
references.reason: This paper introduces the Kinetics dataset, a large-scale video dataset used for action recognition, which is leveraged in the current paper for pre-training the video backbone.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised video anomaly detection via normalizing flows with implicit latent features
references.reason: This paper proposes an unsupervised video anomaly detection method using normalizing flows, which is related to the weakly-supervised approach used in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Real-world anomaly detection in surveillance videos
references.reason: This paper addresses real-world anomaly detection in surveillance videos, which is directly related to the multi-domain learning problem tackled in the current paper.
